page.title: 05Houses, Brickhill, Bedford
page.content: In round figures, there are 1,500 houses and 5,000 people in the square kilometre around Scott School. The cost of the houses in this area varies from Â£27,000 to Â£75,000 but prices are increasing each year because of inflation and because of the electrification of the rail link with London two years ago. This has increased Bedford's popularity with commuters. However, in the school survey of 200 homes and 791 adults and children, only 17 adults worked daily in London. 147 of the families lived in either a semi-detached or detached house with front and back gardens. These typical houses have 3/4 bedrooms, a bathroom with w.c., a second w.c., a living- room, a kitchen/dining-area and a garage. All have central heating and bigger houses have en suite bathrooms.
